title: Cat. 45 Teapot, 1848
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Obadiah Rich (American, 1809–1888)  
Boston, Massachusetts  
Silver and wood; height: 14.4 cm (5 3/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of Mr. and Mrs. William B. McIlvaine, Jr., 1981.3

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 45.1)

Engraved on side: R.L. 1848. L.L.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Jonathan Trace, Putnam Valley, NY, by 1981.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1981.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art Institute of Chicago (1981), p. 82, fig. 68 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Teapot, 1848.

fig. 45.1 </section>
